results.title: The Cruise
results.creator_credit: Faith Hubley, John Hubley, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film by John and Faith Hubley in which everything moves to music and where a juke box is the center of everything. It is a fable of our times, about people and numbers and chance, set on a cruise ship where everything is most correct until a maverick passenger decides to flout the rules. Animation by Phil Duncan, Gary Mooney and Les Drew. Music by Benny Carter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Faith Hubley, John Hubley, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Cruickshank family
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Suzanne Parker and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Security”.
This film deals with the problems faced by the Cruickshank family living on the land - insecure employment, lack of constant medical benefits cover, and the need to continue in unpredictable work in a rural environment. They are aware of their own powerlessness against accident, sickness, and the economic forces governing their lives and they can only hope for the best.

results.title: Crucifixion: theme and variations
results.creator_credit: George Jacobson, J.H. Lenauer, Mavis Lyons and Filmmakers
results.brief_description: Interpretation by three Flemish artists, of the theme of the Crucifixion from the original paintings in the Johnson Collection at the Philadelphia Museum of Art. The following are studied: “Christ carrying the Cross” by the Master of the Turin Adoration (1490-1510); “Christ on the Cross and the Virgin and St. John” by Roger van der Weyden (1399-1464); and “Pieta” by Gerard David (1460-1523). Commentary by Murvyn Vye.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Jacobson, J.H. Lenauer, Mavis Lyons and Filmmakers

results.title: The Crucifixion
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: The camera studies, in close-up, the crucifixion scenes in silver bas relief by the artist Matcham Skipper. This film was photographed in St Mary’s Church, Ivanhoe, Victoria. In place of a narration, the soundtrack uses biblical quotations. Photographed by Giorgio Mangiamele.

results.title: Crow boy
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A shy boy attending a village school in Japan withdraws into a world of his own until a kind and wise teacher draws him out and his classmates discover his special talent. Based on the book of the same title by Taro Yashima.

results.title: Crossroads of life
results.creator_credit: Henri Storck and United Nations. Dept. of Public Information
results.brief_description: Hihglights several cases of children with serious problems, who are helped to understand their needs and become healthier people. After becoming delinquent, they are treated in a children’s institution. Scenes show therapeutic work to help them relieve aggressive feelings. International cooperation to improve methods of prevention, observation and treatment of delinquency is urged.

results.title: Crossing the Great Sagrada
results.creator_credit: Adrian Brunel, Lionel Rich, All-Britisch Productions and Priceless Pictures
results.brief_description: In 1924, during one of the periodic slumps in the British film industry, Adrian Brunel amused himself and many others by producing a series of burlesques. This film tells of Holmes, Sweet and Holmes’ voyage by sea to Africa where they then set off, on camels, across the desert to finally arrive at the famous Cascara of Sagrada falls. A comic travel film of the silent era.

results.title: Cross your heart and hope to live
results.creator_credit: Bert Christensen and Danish Heart Foundation
results.brief_description: Looks at the rising incidence of heart disease in Western society. Of babies born with perfect arteries, by the age of 15 virtually everybody has ruined them to some extent. Points out that the “good life” is responsible - smoking, lack of physical activity, excess fatty substances in the blood, high blood pressure and overweight are to blame. Suggestions are made for overcoming the problem.

results.title: The Cross road crash
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Indicates that crossroads are one of the most likely places to have a collision. Lists the type of crossroads and discusses the avoidance of situations leading to accidents. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Crossbanding and jointing veneers
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Topical Film Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Both sides of the wood are veneered to prevent warping. The method of making this is demonstrated through an example of a door made of laminated wood. It is explained how to veneer the face of the door to match the edges and when a piece of veneer is not wide enough to cover a surface, how a joint must be made.
